title: STS-31
desc: During the final count, a valve issue occurred, which led to a hold at T-31 seconds. The valve was manually cycled to correct the problem, and the launch proceeded successfully at 7:33:50.99 a.m.c.d.t.

title: GMP
desc: Network of satellites that provide next-generation global observations. Launched on February 27, 2014 with the objective of measuring the earth's precipitation.

title: CALIPSO
desc: Cloud-Aerosol Lidar and Infrared Pathfinder Satellite. Its objective is to probe the properties of the Earth's thin clouds and aerosols and was launched on April 28, 2006.

title: Aura
desc: It was launched on July 15, 2004, with the objective of measuring trace gases in the Earth's atmosphere.

title: Terra
desc: Terra was launched on December 18, 1999 with the purpose of studying the interactions between the atmosphere, land and oceans.

title: OSTM
desc: Ocean Surface Topography Mission It was launched on June 20, 2008 with the objective of measuring the height of the sea surface.

title: SORCE
desc: It was launched on January 25, 2003 with the objective of measuring incoming x-ray, ultraviolet, and infrared radiation.

title: Landsat 8
desc: It was launched on February 11, 2013 with the objective of providing moderate resolution measurements of regions of the Earth.
